events.originalText: An Amtrak Cascades passenger train derailed near DuPont, Washington, killing three people and injuring sixty-five others.
events.subtitle: Amtrak Cascades
events.headline: Amtrak Cascades train derails near DuPont, Washington, killing three

events.originalText: The Copenhagen Summit on climate change ended with the drafting of the non-binding Copenhagen Accord.
events.subtitle: 2009 United Nations Climate Change Conference
events.headline: Copenhagen Summit ends with drafting of non-binding Copenhagen Accord

events.originalText: The school board of Oakland, California, passed a controversial resolution officially declaring African-American Vernacular English to be a separate language or dialect.
events.subtitle: Oakland Unified School District
events.headline: Oakland school board declares African-American Vernacular English separate language

events.originalText: Mohammad Mofatteh, an Iranian philosopher, was assassinated by the Furqan Group.
events.subtitle: Mohammad Mofatteh
events.headline: Iranian philosopher Mohammad Mofatteh assassinated by Furqan Group

events.originalText: On Her Majesty's Secret Service, the sixth James Bond film and the only one to star George Lazenby, premiered at the Odeon Leicester Square in London.
events.subtitle: On Her Majesty's Secret Service (film)
events.headline: James Bond film 'On Her Majesty's Secret Service' premieres in London

events.originalText: Epimetheus, one of the moons of Saturn, was discovered, but was mistaken for Janus; it took twelve years to determine that they are two distinct objects sharing the same orbit.
events.subtitle: Epimetheus (moon)
events.headline: Moon of Saturn, Epimetheus, discovered mistaken for Janus

events.originalText: Ghanaian and other African students organized a protest in Moscow's Red Square in response to the alleged murder of medical student Edmund Assare-Addo.
events.subtitle: 1963 Moscow protest
events.headline: African students protest in Moscow's Red Square over alleged murder

events.originalText: The United States launched SCORE (rocket pictured), the world's first communications satellite.
events.subtitle: SCORE (satellite)
events.headline: United States launches world's first communications satellite, SCORE

events.originalText: Second World War: The Luftwaffe won a victory over the Royal Air Force in the Battle of the Heligoland Bight, greatly influencing both sides' future aerial warfare strategy.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Luftwaffe wins Battle of the Heligoland Bight over Royal Air Force

events.originalText: Playing indoors at Chicago Stadium on a modified American football field, the Chicago Bears defeated the Portsmouth Spartans in the first playoff game of the National Football League.
events.subtitle: Chicago Stadium
events.headline: Chicago Bears defeat Portsmouth Spartans in first NFL playoff game

events.originalText: The Jew's Christmas, the first American film to include a rabbi as a character, was released.
events.subtitle: The Jew's Christmas
events.headline: First American film with rabbi character, 'The Jew's Christmas', released

events.originalText: Gaston de Chasseloup-Laubat (pictured) set the first official land speed record, averaging 63.16 km/h (39.245 mph) over 1 km (0.62 mi) in Achères, France.
events.subtitle: Gaston de Chasseloup-Laubat
events.headline: Gaston de Chasseloup-Laubat sets first official land speed record in France

events.originalText: In Angola, New York, the last coach of a Lake Shore Railway train derailed, plunged 40 feet (12 m) down a gully, and caught fire, resulting in approximately 49 deaths.
events.subtitle: Angola, New York
events.headline: Last coach of Lake Shore Railway train derails in Angola, New York, resulting in 49 deaths

events.originalText: Portuguese forces and their Imbangala allies defeated the Kongo army at the Battle of Mbumbi.
events.subtitle: Imbangala
events.headline: Portuguese forces defeat Kongo army at Battle of Mbumbi

events.originalText: Muslims in Granada began a rebellion against their Castilian rulers in response to forced conversions to Catholicism.
events.subtitle: Granada
events.headline: Muslims in Granada rebel against Castilian rulers over forced conversions
